label: 戸籍
本: The Emergence of Japanese Kingship . Stanford University Press . 1997
説明文: census records to be submitted every six years, recording the members of ko. According to the ritsuryō codes, members of the ko were to be registered, with notations as to their sex, age, tribute-payment status, and kubunden held. The first realm-wide census was performed in 670, and the system continued into the Heian period. [律令、口分田]
